Most personal development advice isn't valid for women...Here are my top 10 personal development tips for women:1. Prioritize sleep: Getting 7-8 hours of sleep is a game changer if you're constantly feeling burned out. Reset your body first thing by making sleep a priority.2. The 5 am plan: The 5 am club has its benefits, but don't follow it blindly. If you're already struggling to sleep, waking up earlier won't help.3. Take care of your body: Don't push yourself too hard during workouts. Make sure to rest, recover, and take your supplements. Your body needs to be energized to get the most out of your workout.4. Meditate: You don't need to meditate for an hour to maintain your sanity. As a working woman, you already have a lot on your plate, especially if you have a family. Find what works for you and embrace the chaos. Even 10 minutes of quiet time every day can help you feel sane.5. Multitasking: Women have an innate ability to multitask, but be careful not to take on too many tasks at once. Try to limit yourself to 2-3 tasks at a time to avoid feeling overwhelmed.6. Write and plan: Dump all the information in your head somewhere other than your brain. Use post-its and planners to organize your day, week, month, or quarter. Meal planning can also help reduce weekly overwhelm and make grocery shopping easier. Notion is a great app I use to keep my life organized.7. Ask for help: Don't try to do everything alone. Asking for help from trusted people at work or home is a sign of strength, not weakness.8. Prioritize yourself: Don't always try to please others. Choose what is important to you and be diplomatic. Not every fight is worth fighting.9. Self-care: Pay attention to what your mind is craving and do it. Whether it's a night out with friends or a spa visit, prioritize self-care.10. Connect with other women: Strong connections with other women are essential for personal growth. Within your circle, you can be raw, vulnerable, strong, empathetic, and a complete fool yet feel safe and understood.#womenentrepreneurs #women #womenatwork

We are thrilled to share that PhonePe has launched a new Shopping app called “Pincode”, built on top of the ONDC platform. The app will focus on hyperlocal commerce and is now available for download on Google Play Store and App Store. Pincode is currently live only for customers in Bangalore and will launch in other cities very soon. It will promote local shopkeepers and sellers and hopes to digitally connect each city’s consumers with all their neighborhood stores that they usually buy from offline, with the convenience of online ordering, great discounts, and instant refunds and returns.Speaking at the launch event Sameer Nigam, Founder & CEO, PhonePe said, “We are very excited to launch Pincode. Pincode is a brand-new shopping app that offers a revolutionary new approach to e-commerce, which puts all the local stores and sellers at the heart of the digital shopping growth story. Pincode is built on the ONDC network, which allows us to generate demand for merchants digitized by various seller platforms in an inclusive manner while creating new opportunities for growth and driving innovation at scale.” Click here to read more - https://lnkd.in/g6_pR75b#phonepe #pincode #ondc #launch #shopping #consumers #ecommerce

Das?! Das sind doch keine Influencer:innen! Als ich zum „IBM Influencer Forum“ eingeladen wurde, dachte ich nur: „Ähm, ja… da passe ich ja rein wie eine Veganerin beim Metzger!“ 😅Ich bin kein Fan vom Influencertum. Meine Oma hat mir beigebracht, dass „Beeinflussen“ keine positive Eigenart ist. Und ich finde sie hat Recht. Umso mehr begeistert war ich, als ich die Teilnehmenden in Ehningen gesehen habe: alles Menschen, die für Themen stehen und einstehen. 🫶Menschen, die ich gerne als Topic Leaders bezeichne. Denn wenn man sich mit ihnen trifft oder ihnen auf LinkedIn folgt stellt man schnell fest, dass es hier nicht um Beeinflussen geht, sondern um voneinander lernen.Egal mit wem ich gesprochen habe: ich habe gelernt, gelacht, diskutiert, gegrübelt und das Gefühl gehabt, noch ewig mit allen sprechen zu können, weil sie viel zu sagen hatten… 🤓Vielen Dank, liebe Petra und lieber Daniel, dass ihr den Ort des Austauschs ermöglicht habt. 🙏 ( Für alle, die gerne etwas über den Quantencomputer wissen wollen – es kommt noch ein Posting dazu. 😉)Welchen Topic Leadern sollte ich noch folgen?#thoughtleadership #leaders #community #ibm #linkedin

The big elephant in the room: How to kindle a trust-based work culture in your organization?Honestly, it’s a grind—but only when you fail to understand the basic elements to set the foundation of trust.Here are three learnings we had on our way to building an impeccable work culture:Learning #1 — Supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and being unbiasedMany organizations focus on filling up their workforce by offering opportunities to underrated groups. For sure, the intention to infuse D&I is strong here, yet companies fall short from employees’ point of view leading to discrepancies. That’s why it’s better to evaluate employee’s job skills and EQ level to counter the situation.Learning #2 — Hiring based on IQ and EQ levelsWhen hiring someone, we look to grade their skills, but also look for indicators of the kind of human they are. We discuss each candidate with the panel for their perspectives.  Learning #3 — Providing opportunitiesIf there are people in the team who are ready to take on more responsibility, we promote a top performer instead of hiring someone new — you can say — we lateral hire employees from our internal teams. This helped boost employee’s morale and motivation leading to positive growth.We wrote a detailed report on this that highlights our 6 learnings. Read it to find out more.Link in comments⬇️#diversity #workculture

Opportunities are all around us. It's when luck meets preparedness that we’re able to seize them. 💯The right opportunity will knock on our door when we have already prepared ourselves to answer it.Here are five ways we can prepare ourselves for success:🍏1. Set specific goals: Define our goals in every area of our life, personal and professional. Make them specific, measurable, and achievable.🍏2. Develop a plan: Once we have a clear set of goals, create a plan that will help us achieve them. Break down the tasks into smaller, manageable steps, and regularly evaluate our progress.🍏3. Build a strong network: Connect with people who can support and motivate us on our journey towards success. Surround ourselves with positive and like-minded individuals who can offer valuable guidance and advice.🍏4. Continuously learn and improve: To achieve success, we need to have the knowledge and skills required to take the right steps. Invest time in learning and upgrading our skillset to stay ahead of the competition.🍏5. Maintain a positive mindset: Stay positive and believe in ourselves , even when faced with challenges or setbacks. Celebrate our successes, no matter how small, and use them as motivation to keep moving forward.I invite you to Follow me Kat Downen & #REPOST 💫 this video to show your supportCC - Kat Downen VC - reserved to respective owners#success #humanity #inspiration #opportunity #india

Sharing step-by-step plan & resources I followed to master my programming during college & crack Infosys SES, Morgan Stanley, Adobe interviews.  🔥 𝐒𝐚𝐯𝐞 & 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐡𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐧𝐨𝐰 :) 📍𝐍𝐞𝐞𝐝 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐮𝐦𝐞/𝐂𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐫 𝐇𝐞𝐥𝐩, 𝐋𝐞𝐭𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐜𝐭:https://lnkd.in/dcDEQeGsHere's my strategy:🚀 𝐒𝐭𝐞𝐩 𝟏: 𝐂𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐬𝐞 𝐚 𝐋𝐚𝐧𝐠𝐮𝐚𝐠𝐞There are many programming languages out there, so it can be challenging to know which one to start with. The best approach is to choose a language that aligns with your interests and goals. For example, if you want to develop websites, learning HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a great place to start. If you're interested in machine learning, you may want to start with Python.🚀𝐒𝐭𝐞𝐩 𝟐: 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐁𝐚𝐬𝐢𝐜𝐬Once you've chosen a language, it's time to learn the basics. You can find countless resources online, including tutorials, videos, and online courses. Here are five websites that offer free resources to help you learn the basics:- Codecademy- FreeCodeCamp- Udemy- Khan Academy- W3SchoolsThese websites offer a wide range of courses covering everything from programming fundamentals to more advanced topics.🚀 𝐒𝐭𝐞𝐩 𝟑: 𝐁𝐮𝐢𝐥𝐝 𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐬The best way to solidify your understanding of programming is to build projects. This not only helps you apply what you've learned but also gives you a chance to put your skills to the test. You can find project ideas online or come up with your own. Here are five websites that offer free project ideas:- GitHub- Project Euler- HackerRank- CodeWars- CodinGameThese websites offer a wide range of project ideas, from simple to complex, that you can use to practice your programming skills.🚀 𝐒𝐭𝐞𝐩 𝟒: 𝐍𝐞𝐭𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐤 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐂𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞Networking and collaborating with other programmers can help you learn new skills, get feedback on your projects, and stay motivated. Here are five websites where you can network with other programmers:- Stack Overflow- GitHub- Reddit- Discord- HackerRankThese websites offer a platform where you can connect with other programmers, ask questions, and share ideas.🚀 𝐒𝐭𝐞𝐩 𝟓: 𝐒𝐭𝐚𝐲 𝐔𝐩 𝐭𝐨 𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐞Finally, programming is an ever-evolving field, so it's essential to stay up to date with the latest developments. You can do this by reading blogs, following industry experts on social media, attending webinars, and attending conferences. Do you also think 🤔💭🎭 Art is genuinely a gift to the world.💃I believe that any form of art is important for people's lives. Here are a few reasons why:🎯Personal expression: Art provides an outlet for personal expression, allowing individuals to communicate their thoughts, feelings, and experiences in a unique and creative way.🎯Cultural expression: Art reflects the culture and history of a society, providing a means for individuals and communities to connect with their heritage and traditions.🎯Emotional and mental health: Art can have a therapeutic effect, helping individuals to process and cope with difficult emotions and experiences.🎯Aesthetic appreciation: Art allows individuals to appreciate and find beauty in the world around them.🎯Social commentary: Art can be used to make social and political statements, bringing attention to important issues 🎯Creative problem-solving: Art encourages creativity and innovation, helping individuals to think outside the box and find novel solutions to problems.😇Overall, art is an important part of the human experience and has the potential to enrich people's lives in a variety of ways.Just have a look on this wonderful art, This video makes my day!!!! I am energized each time I have the opportunity to spend time with our teams in the field. It's not just the commitment to customers I see, but the stories I hear about how our employees have been able to succeed and thrive at Amazon. I had the chance to meet Vaishakhi Nanavati at TEB9, one of our operations sites in Somerset, New Jersey, in January. Vaishakhi's story is pretty incredible. She emigrated from India to the United States two years ago—and lucky for us, accepted a job working with Amazon. Vaishakhi told me about her journey of starting out working mostly nights, and really thriving as she learned about how we deliver packages to customers. A few months into her role, Vaishakhi found a mentor in TEB9 Senior Operations Manager, Jessie Bixby, and six months later was promoted to Process Assistant. But the story doesn’t end here. Thanks to Amazon's Career Choice program, which offers employees pre-paid education and skills training, Vaishakhi has started working toward a college degree (majoring in Business Administration) and is also taking ESL classes to help improve her English. Vaishakhi, your determination is inspiring—and I'm excited to hear about your continued success at Amazon.

I am thrilled to share that I have taken up a new position as Engineering Lead - Backend at inFeedo. Special thanks to Varun Puri & Akshay Rastogi for giving me high hopes to be able to make this switch. Also Richa Anchan & Abha Khurana for this smooth transition.I want to take this moment to reflect back on my 4.9 years of journey at StoryXpress, it was a tremendous ride. I joined the company when there were just 4 people working, CEO, CTO and another techy, when we had a single product. Today, I can proudly say I was a part of that journey where the company grew to 30 people and 6 products today. It was an insane ride filled with its ups and downs. Special thanks to Chinmay Jindal & Ankit Mishra, for being the best people to work for & with, and keep me all motivated and running through these years. The trust and faith they showed in a newly graduated guy was immense and I did everything in my power to keep that intact. Another person I would highly appreciate is Varanasi Shashank, he was one of the best colleagues to work with. Always standing by the side, fuel to my engine, and help me motor the ideas and products throughout these years. Special thanks to Virendra Pratap, Jibin Joseph, Aman Kumar, Tamana M., Kashish Behl, Himanshu Kumar Das, Sameen Ahmad, Dhawal Singh P., Aradhya Trivedi, Yash Panchal, Jeel Bhavsar, Prateek Chouhan and many others who have over the years supported and encouraged me throughout my time with the company. I will always be very grateful to you guys for being there in this journey and giving me the lifetime of experiences.StoryXpress taught me a lot of things, one of those is "Things can go to ashes, but never lose the trust in you, if you trust yourself everything can get right back". I wish all the very best to the team at StoryXpress to do wonders and keep breaking those barriers. You will be very close to my heart. :)To the new beginning!!  🎉

Belgium's second city, the Port of Antwerp is one of the largest and busiest ports in Europe. A network of railway lines and #highways serves this dense metropolis which is home to about 1.2 million people. Sweco Nederland accomplished a complex redesign for the Oosterweel Connection Antwerp road project by sharing #3D model information between specialized design teams. Sweco utilized a number of Bentley solutions - ProjectWise, Openroads Designer, and LumenRT - to implement significant #road changes within eight weeks. Quoting John Quincy Adams, ex-US president, "Successful leaders inspire others to learn more, do more and become more". Being in this industry for more than 2 decades now, I was fortunate to be around and work with many such inspiring leaders. It has kept the fire in me going and always aspiring for the next challenge. But what happened last few weeks is something that I had not even dreamt of. So, here is what happened. I was announced as one of the finalists for "Inspire" category for this year's ADV D India Awards. This is an individual award that celebrate women who challenge the status quo of technology. From the time of announcement of finalists, wishes poured in from all around. I felt overwhelmed with so many calls and pings from Siemens colleagues with whom I had hardly interacted. I had never realized that my work or coaching initiative or even the little talks in different Siemens events had such a great influence and gained me supporters / well wishers from all Siemens ADV D India locations. It sounded like everyone (except me) were confident that I would win the award. And guess what, I did win :). Up until then, I had the feeling of impostor syndrome, always thinking that I was lucky to succeed or things just worked in my favor. But this time, I had to really give credit to myself. It would be impossible to pass through all the levels of juries with just luck. What made the award even more special is when my manager Chethan Seegehalli, peers and team cheered and celebrated my win, when our CEO Pankaj Vyas said "Well deserved". So, here i am proudly talking about my win (getting comfortable with the uncomfortable feeling of talking about myself) as this one is special :)

Flipkart is not laying off its employees. Read that again! Flipkart is NOT laying off its employees! Sounds strange considering the news that’s all around us, isn't it? 👀Recently, Krishna Raghavan, the Chief people officer at Flipkart said and I quote, “.. there are no mass layoffs happening at Flipkart.”This brings us to an important question. When the biggest tech giants of the world are struggling in this time of turmoil, what different has Flipkart done to retain its talent?Here are 3 strategies that have worked in Flipkart’s favour so far:1️⃣ Prioritising responsible hiring:Unlike many of its competitors in the tech and IT services sector, Flipkart is not using "over-hiring" as a justification for layoffs. The company states that they do not hire thousands and then resort to extreme measures to reduce headcount.2️⃣ Facilitating internal mobility:Flipkart understands that monotony and lack of lateral movement lead to a large chunk of employees quitting their jobs. To optimise its hiring efforts, Flipkart has lately increased internal job postings against hiring from the industry.This helps employees already acquainted with the company to move to different job roles of their choice. It increases the overall efficiency of the company while saving them a lot on hiring processes.3️⃣ Generous employee stock options:In November 2022, Flipkart went for an ESOP buyback plan of $700 million and also gave an increment to over 4000 senior managers to bring in pay parity within the company. Flipkart has now become one of the very few startups in India where ESOPs actually turn into liquidation opportunities for employees.Overall, Flipkart's approach to talent management demonstrates true commitment to responsible hiring & providing growth opportunities for its employees, even in times of uncertainty. ✨Such stories are rare to find in these times of turmoil and ought to be shared! What are your thoughts? Tell me in the comments 💬Also, I keep sharing such stories on business, marketing & finance. If you enjoy them, do consider following me (Anurag Bansal) for more!#jobs #job #business #flipkart

I sometimes joke that the Google Dublin office has the potential to be one of the toughest offices to be fasting for Ramadan in- with snacks and delicious meals seemingly lurking around every corner.Our wonderful Food team has worked with the Muslims@Dublin Googler community to ensure every Muslim on campus feels included and doesn't miss out on their wonderful offerings, throughout the month of Ramadan.Two standout examples of this:i) Delicious packed meal boxes for those who are fasting to take home and enjoy for their iftar (breaking of the fast)ii) A community iftar dinner which was enjoyed last night, with a specially prepared menu and selection of treatsThese incredible initiatives stemmed out of our site Food team holding out a hand to the Muslim community, listening to the experiences & challenges many of us face during Ramadan, and taking action to help the whole community feel included, energized and valued.On behalf of the Muslims@Dublin community, a massive thank you to Alex Murphy, Stijn Kuppens and the entire Food team behind the scenes, for making this Ramadan one of the most special yet for so many Muslim Googlers in Dublin.And a personal thank you to the Muslims@ org on all levels, from the Dublin committee to global, for working hard to represent Muslim voices across the business.

The Power of Learning philosophy is built on the belief that the best way to absorb knowledge that lasts is for learners to take responsibility for their own learning. Learners should think, explore and discover for themselves. They should make mistakes and learn from them.The Learning Spiral is how we unlock The Power of Learning by recreating a spontaneous learning process:Motivation – we motivate by triggering curiosity and enthusiasm.Information – we provide only the necessary information.Process – we use dialogue, play and reflection to let learners process the new information.Aha! moment – when everyone reaches individual ‘aha’ moments of understanding and insight.Action – we help everyone turn their insights into actions for their daily work.We at Appinventiv repeat The Learning Spiral over and over again, because we don’t believe in shortcuts. Real learning–the kind that moves people and organisations–takes time and repetition.It’s a fast and compelling way to increase  knowledge, improve engagement and make change happen.They play. Everyone wins. The company truly earns.#motivation #learning #change #engagement #work #growth #mindset #futuristic

Last week, my team (Meta Brands & Marketing Legal) had its first in-person onsite since the start of the pandemic, and I can't express how energized and grateful I am to have seen my colleagues from across the US, APAC & EMEA.It's been a challenging few years, with remote work becoming the norm and in-person interactions (the non-VC kind) few and far between. But getting the chance to see everyone face-to-face, catch up on work and life, and collaborate on projects in person was truly invigorating.There's just something special about being in the same physical space as your teammates.  I'm fascinated by the prospects of the metaverse and having tried it, it is quite compelling and getting better and better each day.  But in person time is absolutely special!  Not only did it make communication and collaboration more seamless, it also fostered a stronger sense of camaraderie and team spirit that's hard to replicate virtually.  We were able to have spontaneous meetings and breakout sessions, grabbed lunch and coffee together to build trust and bond, and engaged in team-building activities that simply couldn't be done over video.While I enjoyed all our team programming and learned tons throughout from my amazing teammates, my favorite part of our onsite was the visit to and volunteer work at the Ecumenical Hunger Program of East Palo Alto (www.ehpcares.org), where we helped stock shelves and distribute food to those in need in our surrounding community. 🙏🏼   A close second favorite moment was Lauren Tang and I celebrating our 10th work anniversaries, or as we call it, Metaversaries (and the team gifting me an amazing personalized Arsenal F.C. jersey 🏆 ).  Some fun pictures attached. Overall, I feel incredibly grateful to have had the opportunity to reunite with the team in person. It's reminded me of the importance of human connection and collaboration, and I'm looking forward to more in-person gatherings in the future.  Thank you, BAM team, for making this time so memorable and meaningful.  Til next time...With Lauren Tang, Scott Minden, Austin Phillips, Renee Keen, Paul H. Sousa, Mick Stewart, Rich Daniels, Esther Ono, Paige Stapleton, Meghana B., Alistair Taylor, Jennifer Okafor, James Farris, Jen Fryhling, Nakia Cunningham, Varty H., Michelle Manahan, Eileen Fong, Allison Raines.#meta #legal #thankyou #teambuilding #community #volunteer

About 1000+ applications, I am still in the market after being laid off for 2 months. I had 30+ interviews and made it to 4 final rounds."Unfortunately, we decided to move forward with other candidates because we do not sponsor.""Unfortunately, we are not going to move forward with your candidacy due to the unexpected hiring freeze.""The team reviewed your background and your conversation in great detail, and unfortunately, your skill sets aren't quite aligned with our ongoing projects and what we expect from this role.""This was a tough decision as the team thought very highly of you and felt you would be a good addition to the team. Due to the current needs of the team, they have decided to go with another candidate."Although I did well in the interview, there is still no luck. Every morning, I don't want to wake up because I know I have one less day in the States (F-1 OPT visa). I study hard on doing coding exercises, system design, and do side projects for learning new tech stacks. As an early-career software engineer, there is no room for us to grow as the tech industry has been really competitive. Companies are looking for people who have hands-on skills, no matter how much experience you have.I have lost all my entertainment. I cut off dinner with my friends; I don't meet with people. I don't have time to hit the gym. The only thing I did and made me comfortable is to sit in front of my desk and keep grinding.Job searching is exhausting, and so is being laid off, but they can't destroy me. I will keep applying for jobs, doing coding exercises, studying hard until I remove my green banner.I am a software engineer with 3 years of experience. If you are hiring people who are not trying to make a living in the States but surviving, I am the right person.#techlayoffs #jobhunting #softwareengineer

I'm thrilled to announce that three of my papers have been accepted to CVPR 2023. I'm sharing the titles and summaries of each paper below:1. "Hyperbolic Contrastive Learning for Visual Representations beyond Objects" by Shlok Mishra*, Songwei Ge*, Simon Kornblith, Chun-Liang Li, David Jacobs. Our proposed Hyperbolic loss helps to better encode scenes and objects. Check out the code at https://lnkd.in/gts-548P. Paper : https://lnkd.in/gMGUW2bP2. "MAGE: MAsked Generative Encoder to Unify Representation Learning and Image Synthesis" by Tianhong Li, Huiwen Chang, Shlok Mishra, Han Zhang, Dina Katabi, Dilip Krishnan. MAGE is a unified framework for generative modelling and representation learning, achieving state-of-the-art results in both class-unconditional image generation and linear probing on ImageNet-1K. You can find the code at https://lnkd.in/gDJqHric.Paper: https://lnkd.in/gPyrU-9S3. "HaLP: Hallucinating Latent Positives for Skeleton-based Self-Supervised Learning of Actions" by Anshul Shah, Aniket Roy, Ketul Shah, Shlok Kumar Mishra, David Jacobs, Anoop Cherian, Rama Chellappa. Our method generates positive samples in the latent space for self-supervised representation learning of skeleton sequences. Stay tuned for the code and paper!I want to thank all my amazing collaborators and mentors who supported and helped me throughout. A special thanks to my advisor David Jacobs, Dilip Krishnan, Anshul Shah, Abhishek Sharma [Hiring], Kuntal Sengupta, Ankan Bansal, Christian Häne, and many others.On a related note, I'm currently seeking job opportunities in generative modelling and self-supervised learning. If you know of any relevant openings, please reach out to me. #generativeai #cvpr #computervision

Augmented reality (AR) is the integration of digital information with the user's environment in real time. Unlike virtual reality (VR), which creates a totally artificial environment, AR users experience a real-world environment with generated perceptual information overlaid on top of it.Augmented reality is used to either visually change natural environments in some way or to provide additional information to users. The primary benefit of AR is that it manages to blend digital and three-dimensional (3D) components with an individual's perception of the real world. AR has a variety of uses, from helping in decision-making to entertainment.AR delivers visual elements, sound and other sensory information to the user through a device like a smartphone or glasses. This information is overlaid onto the device to create an interwoven experience where digital information alters the user's perception of the real world. The overlaid information can be added to an environment or mask part of the natural environment. #augmentedreality

L'industrie du jeu vidéo vient de vivre une semaine dont on se souviendra longtemps... Tout ce que tu dois savoir des récentes actualités à ne pas manquer 👇🎨 Epic Games repousse les limites de Fortnite avec l'Unreal Editor. Cette intégration permet désormais aux joueurs de créer des expériences plus immersives et personnalisées qu'auparavant, renforçant la position de Fortnite comme plateforme créative. Maximiser l'interopérabilité entre les moteurs de rendu et proposer un meilleur partage de revenus avec les créateurs semblent être au cœur de ce nouveau dispositif, qui pourrait bien bouleverser la "creator economy". 🔫 Après des semaines de teasing, Valve corporation "surprend" avec l'annonce de CS 2 prévu pour cet été ! Le "CS:GO killer" fait déjà parler de lui, et les retours semblent unanimes : la communauté attend de pied ferme cette mise à jour. Preuve à l'appui : l'annonce a permis à la licence de battre son record de joueurs simultanés sur Steam, avec un pic atteignant 1 519 457 joueurs. 📉 Selon le SELL - Syndicat des Éditeurs de Logiciels de Loisirs, le marché français du jeu vidéo connaît une baisse de son chiffre d'affaires en 2022, avec 5,5 milliards d'euros (-1.6% par rapport à 2021). Cette baisse s'explique notamment par la crise économique que nous rencontrons actuellement, ou encore la pénurie de composants impactant sensiblement les ventes de consoles et autres périphériques. Une baisse relative, qui permet surtout de souligner la résilience de l'industrie en ces temps compliqués. 🌐 CCP Games, développeur du célèbre jeu EVE Online, sécurise 40 M$ de financement pour développer un nouveau jeu basé sur la technologie Web3. Ce financement soutiendra la création d'un MMO de science-fiction décentralisé. La technologie permettra aux joueurs de posséder et de monétiser leurs biens virtuels.🍿 Netflix étoffe son offre de jeux vidéo avec 40 nouveaux titres à venir pour 2023, dont des exclusivités Ubisoft ! Une stratégie ambitieuse pour la plateforme de streaming, qui souhaite se positionner comme un leader dans l'industrie du jeu vidéo dans les prochaines années.📉 L'action FaZe Clan connaît une chute "embarrassante", avec des performances boursières décevantes qui font parler d'elle, et par ricochet, du secteur de l'esport. L'équipe américaine pourrait bientôt être délistée du Nasdaq... 🎮 Le jeu MultiVersus encore sous le feu des projecteurs ! Ses joueurs réclament un remboursement sur les achats in-game après avoir appris la fermeture prochaine de la bêta. Les développeurs travaillent sur des mises à jour et prévoient un lancement officiel courant 2024, mais cela n'a pas suffi à calmer la frustration de la communauté qui attendait beaucoup de ce titre, qui, pour rappel, a perdu plus de 90% de sa player-base depuis ses premiers jours._ _ _ Dis-moi ce que tu penses de tout ça en commentaire 👇Tu ne veux rien manquer de l'actualité forte du jeu vidéo ? 🎮Abonne-toi et active la 🔔 sur mon profil 😉#gaming

The holy place of Amarnath!The holy shrine of Amarnath Temple, is located at an elevation of 3,888 meters approx, about 29 kilometers from Pahalgam. Inside the cave is a Shiva Lingam made of ice considered to be the most holy symbol by devotees all across the globe. Devotees visit it in large numbers from June to August, with the pilgrimage tour famously known as Amarnath Yatra, which begins from Chandanwari. It is considered to be one of the 18 Maha Shakti Peethas, or the holiest shrines in Hinduism. The place where the Amarnath Cave stands today is the same place where Lord Shiva explained the meaning of life and eternity to his consort & wife, Goddess Parvati. Bhrigu Muni, a famous sage in Hinduism, was the first person to have discovered this holy site. At that time, the entire Kashmir Valley was submerged under water, and Kashyap Muni, another powerful sage, drained the waters with his divine powers. As the waters cleared, Bhrigu Muni was the first person to have the site of the Shiva Lingam.In 1989, pilgrims numbered between 12,000 and 30,000. In 2011, the numbers reached a peak, crossing 6.3 lakh (630,000) pilgrims. In 2018 pilgrims numbered 2.85 lakh (285,000). The annual pilgrimage has varied between 20 and 60 daysThank you for sharing Gauranga Das #india #lordshiva

Jon Foreman discovered land art while in college and immediately fell in love with it. He felt that the natural world had more in it to be explored, particularly where he lives, Pembrokeshire, Wales.Since the area has an extensive coastline, a huge part of Foreman's work revolves around the stones he finds near the sea. Using everything from tiny pebbles to big rocks, the artist surprises beachgoers with mesmerizing arrangements that never cease to amaze."I create using many natural materials but stone has proven to be the material which I can manipulate best. Be it color, angle, shape, size, placement, spacing," Foreman said. "Typically, I either start with a rough idea of what I'd like to do or no idea whatsoever! Then I collect what I can carry and start by placing stone by stone, steadily losing myself in the process and disconnecting from the stress of everyday life." #art #design #work #artist #photography #creative #stone

Consistency is crucial for successful project completion. Data analysis can help project managers achieve consistency by providing insights into project performance and identifying areas for improvement. Here are some ways data analysis can help:1. Track and analyze project data: Use data analysis tools to track and analyze project data such as cost, schedule, scope, quality, and risk. This helps identify trends, patterns, and issues that affect project consistency.2. Identify areas for improvement: Analyze data to identify areas where improvements can be made to ensure consistent project performance. For example, investigate delays in project phases and implement corrective measures to improve the process.3. Predict project performance: Use data analysis to develop predictive models that forecast project performance and identify potential issues. This helps make informed decisions about resource allocation, scheduling, and risk management.4. Benchmark project performance: Compare project performance to industry standards or best practices to identify areas for improvement and implement best practices to achieve consistency.In conclusion, data analysis is critical for achieving consistency in project management. By using data analysis tools and techniques, project managers can gain insights, identify areas for improvement, and implement corrective measures for consistent project outcomes.#data #dataanalysis #project #projectmanagement #quality #help #projectmanagers #projectmanagers #riskmanagement

Summer Internships are just around the corner. It's high time that you start searching for one if you haven't any.Since the number of candidates willing to intern at this time is at its peak, it gets hard to receive any decent offer if you delay your applications any further.So let's talk about some of the credible sources that you can utilise to find quality internships that with real-world impact in them.1) Government of India Internships -The most interesting thing in a resume is when a person  is  interned in a  national-level organization .Not only do these internships deals with national-level impact but also reflect wonderfully well on your profile.NITI Aayog, Ministry of External Affairs, DPIIT, Invest India, and Centre for Public Policy Research are some of the organisations that provide such internship opportunities.2) Academic InternshipsThese are readily available for master's students, but a lot of undergraduate students pursue them as well.For this, you will have to constantly keep an eye out for official internship schemes by different colleges including IIT, ISB and IIMs.Moreover, you can reach out to the professors via cold mail at any time of the year to secure a massive level of research exposure in your area of interest.3) College's Placement Cell -Yes, I agree that most of the opportunities that come from here may not suit your interest and aspirations. But, completely ignoring this area can cost you that one good internship that could've been all that you were ever searching for.Once or twice a month, you'll see opportunities for profiles such as Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Market Research or Consulting Intern that align with the goals of most undergraduate students.It's one of the quickest methods to secure an internship and sort your summer. So, do not ignore it.What is your experience of applying for summer internships? Is it too taxing? Or do you hear back from the recruiters readily?#summerinternship #internship #consulting #placements #opportunities #marketresearch #experience #research #intern #business #skills# #recruiters #internships #resume #placement #placement2023 #placement2024

It has been 3 months since I started interning at #amazon as an SDE. Going from a single night to do a college project to a full fledged product with a team of incredible people has been an incredible transition! Here are some of the things I learnt during this time:1. Ask questions! You aren’t expected to know everything. 2. Keep learning. There’s no end to it. It’s always day one!3. The real logic is written before you code. Sometimes, coding is the easiest part. 4. Understand your team’s software development life cycle. It helps greatly to plan out your tasks and deadlines. 5. Take breaks, otherwise you’ll get burnt out. 6. Writing clean code can be challenging and comes with experience. Simple code, comments and logs are given importance too.7. Learn to read logs as soon as you can. It can be overwhelming at first when there’s gigabytes of logs for a simple bug, but it gets really easy soon!Let me know what you think about these below ⬇️#sde #intern #softwaredevelopment #maang

I faced many rejections at the start of my corporate life. But then, even after these struggles, I always found ways to make it work.Everything is about your perception!If you think the glass is half empty, then it will always remain empty for you but if you think it is half filled, it will always remain filled for you. Being optimistic in life and especially in the corporate world is extremely important. I've had ample amounts of failures in my life. Starting from college to corporate life. But even after that, I cracked the interviews for Microsoft  & Google .There were many ups and downs, but I never took them negatively. Yes, they sometimes did demotivate me. But I always found my way out. If you look at it positively, you'll always take it as a learning and find success at the end. That is why your perception is most important.Follow Manu Agrawal  #microsoft #work #learning #success #google #perception #consistencymatters

#AD Searching for a job can sometimes feel tough - you’ll be spending time and energy trying to send the best applications for the jobs which are best suited for you. However, an increasing amount of scammers are weaselling their way into our job searches. Unfortunately, they’re getting better at targeting job seekers. This is something LinkedIn is taking action to combat.𝐓𝐨 𝐡𝐞𝐥𝐩 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐬𝐩𝐨𝐭 𝐬𝐨𝐦𝐞 𝐩𝐨𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐬𝐜𝐚𝐦𝐬 𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞 𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐡𝐞𝐥𝐩𝐟𝐮𝐥 𝐭𝐢𝐩𝐬:👉 Trusted employers never need paying as a part of your job search journey. So if someone asks you to pay for something or wants you to share sensitive personal or financial information before you’ve started the job.👉 If a job posting claims to give high pay for little work.👉 If you’re asked to download encrypted software for an interview.👉 If you receive a job offer after one quick, remote interview – that's another red flag.If something doesn’t seem or feel right or it seems too good to be true, then there’s the possibility it is a scam. You can report this to LinkedIn by clicking on the three dots at the top right-hand corner of the job listing, then clicking report and simply selecting the reason.I hope these tips help you feel better prepared to take on your job search more safely. Let me know in the comments below.𝑮𝒐𝒐𝒅 𝒍𝒖𝒄𝒌 𝒇𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒚𝒐𝒖𝒓 𝒏𝒆𝒘 𝒋𝒐𝒃 𝒓𝒐𝒍𝒆.

Finally, LinkedIn verification is here for FREE! Unlike Meta and Twitter.LinkedIn rolls out ways to verify:✅️ Your identity ✅️ Your employment Linkedin's new verification does not include paid subscriptions or blue checkmarks. So if you work at a company, you can get verified using your work mail ID.Or an individual can submit a government ID to get verified. As entrepreneurs and professionals, we understand the importance of authenticity, and that's why this exciting update is for all our users.Such verification will make you look more authentic and credible on the platform. I can't wait to use this feature. I always love LinkedIn launching such amazing features. 👏 Find the link in the comments to read more about this exclusive feature.#linkedin #personalbranding #entrepreneurs #business

I created this on a mobile device and a 4G connection, in about 30 minutes, while waiting at an airport lounge. The text is mine, all images are generated using a free AI image generator. It's scary how powerful AI is as a creative aid. It's going to transform the creative arts like how Photoshop did in the 90s. As a creative person who hasn't done any real creative work in years, this aspect of AI is incredibly exciting. It's going to be an ethics minefield, and I'm not sure how that's going to play out, but purely in terms of tools to aid creativity, this is a Holy Shit moment for me. And it's actually inspiring me to make stuff again, which is super fun. Cheers to that.

Which one do you like the most to put in your futuristic metaverse home? Using Midjourney to conceptualise 3D assets for an internal hackathon for Meta later this week while I’m enjoying PTO in Da Nang. What I love about Midjourney is the social element of people taking your ideas and expanding on them and finding interesting prompts from people in your channel. "𝘊’𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘶𝘯 𝘴𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵 𝘥𝘦 𝘷𝘪𝘦𝘶𝘹""𝘊𝘦 𝘯’𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘮𝘦̂𝘮𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘴 𝘶𝘯 𝘴𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵"Si il y a bien une passion que mon père m’a transmis, c’est le golf ⛳Petit, j’ai essayé de nombreux sports mais aucun ne m’a procuré les mêmes sensations que celui-ci.J’ai vite compris que ce sport allait m’apporter des bienfaits et une discipline à appliquer dans la vie de tous les jours : ✅ La constance  : Un coup d’éclat ne suffit pas, il faut rester concentré du début à la fin si on veut performer. ✅ La patience : Penser coup après coup, y aller step by step, celui qui veut aller trop vite va au final perdre du temps. ✅ La persévérance : Faire un mauvais coup ce n’est pas grave, l’important est de comprendre pourquoi il était mauvais et repartir de l’avant en essayant de faire mieux.𝙈𝙖𝙞𝙨 𝙖𝙪𝙨𝙨𝙞 : ✅ La réduction du stress : C’ est un sport qui aide à réduire le stress et l'anxiété car il faut se concentrer sur le jeu. Le fait qu’il ne se pratique qu’à l’extérieur permet aussi de s’aérer l’esprit. ✅ La déconnexion : L’avantage du golf c’est qu’il se joue souvent dans des cadres agréables, en pleine nature, parfait pour se couper de tout, se vider la tête et avoir l’esprit clair quand on se remet au boulot.✅ Le renforcement des relations sociales : Le golf est souvent joué en groupe, on discute, on se conseille, on se challenge, on rencontre du monde… Et à la fin de la partie, on boit un coup ensemble ! Alors oui, on termine rarement en sueur après une partie de golf. Mais c’est un sport qui nécessite un effort physique et mental qui croyez-moi vous épuise tout autant !Etant de nature très impatient et irrégulier dans mes efforts, ce sport m’a beaucoup aidé à améliorer ces axes là et à retranscrir ces améliorations dans ma vie perso et dans mon travail 💻Comme le dit si bien Bob Toski :“𝘓𝘦 𝘨𝘰𝘭𝘧 𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘶𝘯 𝘴𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵 𝘱𝘢𝘤𝘪𝘧𝘪𝘲𝘶𝘦 𝘲𝘶𝘪 𝘴𝘦 𝘫𝘰𝘶𝘦 𝘷𝘪𝘰𝘭𝘦𝘮𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘥𝘦 𝘭’𝘪𝘯𝘵é𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘶𝘳.”Et vous, avec quel sport est-ce que vous vous challengez ? Dites-le moi en commentaires 💬Pour ceux qui aimeraient en savoir plus sur le golf, je vous invite à aller voir la série “Full Swing” dispo sur Netflix (l'équivalent de “Drive to Survive”) 🏌‍♂️ Bon week-end ! #sport #golf #challenge

On a recent flight from Singapore to Delhi, I found an interesting thing!When looking for seats, I observed that the rightmost seats have letter designations GHJ, skipping the letter ‘I’. I was wondering why is it so?After some Google search, what I found out was interesting. It is because each seat has a row number followed by a letter; letters that may be confused with numbers (I, O, Q, S, or Z) must be avoided, usually for people with dyslexia. The Digital Equipment Corporation (DEC) was the first to implement this, avoiding I (1), O (0) and S (5). The remaining letters are called the DEC alphabet.Also, some airlines may skip some letters because some of the letters are absent from their alphabet (e.g. an airline in Vietnam may have the layout ABC-DEG-HKL in economy class because letters f, j, w, and z are absent from the Vietnamese alphabet). Occasionally, aircraft with a seating structure of 2+2 may letter the seats as "ACDF" to keep with the standard of A/F being window and C/D being aisle on short-haul aircraft (which generally have 3+3 seats).Some airlines omit the row number 13, reputedly because of a widespread superstition that the number is unlucky!Connect/Follow Nishant Kumar for more interesting facts around Tech, Product, Business, Culture, B-Schools, and others!

A friend recommended me a Netflix series “The Playlist”. It is a fictional series based on how Spotify came into existence. It might be fiction, but the tech about Spotify in it is real and it blew my mind.1. The CEO Daniel Ek, asked the former CTO Andreas Ehn to make Spotify as fast as possible. He wanted the song load time after click to be <200 ms which is perceivable by the human ear as instantaneous. This in itself is a great challenge in 2006. But, there was more to it. 2. They were losing money and couldn’t afford to have more servers. So Daniel asked Andreas to build a peer-to-peer network. But, with that, the search and playback would become extremely slow. The two things just do not match.3. The engineers still had to come up with a solution. They came up with a hybrid approach. Most of the time, they could predict what the user would want to listen to next and that song could be prefetched before the user even plays it themselves. And this prefetching would happen through the peer-to-peer network.4. But, 10% of the time, the user might want something different. If I consider myself, I listen to a wide range of song genres from Coldplay to Linkin Park to AP Dhillon. So, for this 10% of the time, the search instead of going to the peer-peer network would go on to the servers. This decreases the load on the servers by 90%. And the songs which were related are played instantaneously.5. I wanted to know if this is real or not. Turns out, it is. There is a Spotify research paper that talks exactly about this. They also talked about how they built this peer-to-peer network and even introduced a new protocol to achieve 245 ms playback latency.6. Now, for you try this. Open Spotify. Play a song. You would realize how fast the playback is after the click on any song you search.7 They clubbed this with client-level caching so that the more played songs can be loaded from the client itself. This cache also acts as a source for the peer-to-peer network. To optimize it even more, when your song is about to end(~30 s). They start prefetching the next song to play. The delay between the songs played is also extremely less.Looking from the top, Spotify looks like just a simple app playing songs stored in a database. But, the engineering effort that went into creating it is just tremendous.I created a video on this on my youtube channel. Do give it a watch to understand this in a better way along with some scenes from the series:https://lnkd.in/gJYyjqZ4Link to research paper in the video description.

Imagine leaving a 30 lakh package salary & then starting a samosa business. And then, building a startup out of it with a turnover of 45 crores.😲I don’t think we need to imagine because Nidhi Singh & Shikhar Veer Singh made it a reality when they started the startup "Samosa Singh” in 2015.But is that all?I have witnessed that whenever a startup is built out of passion & not greed, it is bound to fly high.Shikhar Veer Singh was so much in love with samosa that he sold his house worth 80 lakhs to re-invest the money in increasing the kitchen space. Some might say it is ridiculous, but that is exactly what passion makes you do.Today after following their passion they are making 12 lakhs per day which is way more than their 9 to 5 job salary.🚀Shikhar was a former principal scientist at Biocon & Nidhi a former employee at a pharma company.Despite having a nice comfortable life filled with luxury, they choose to start from scratch & hustle. And honestly, more than chasing money, the hustle is more attractive for successful entrepreneurs. They started cold calling & that is how they got their corporate orders. Moreover, they kept the price affordable.💵Rs 20/plate of aloo samosas (two pieces) & Rs 55/plate of chicken makhani samosa.This increased their demand for samosa all the more. Today this venture named WoknStove Foodworks Pvt Ltd under the brand SAMOSA SINGH has 40 outlets across India.We all talk about doing what we love but only a few take a step forward & work on it.The other day I was reading the news and I found this story from TOI. It said that the idea for selling samosas came to Shikhar when he was studying. But, keeping society's norms in mind and the degrees he had, he chose to become a scientist.  Here are a few takeaway lessons:✅No matter what there is no shame in following your passion.✅You don’t always have to build something from scratch. Like- samosa is an existing product in the market. They just created a new segment that served hygienic samosas.✅Turning your life partner into a business partner can be fruitful. I relate to this a lot. As Mayank Pratap Singh & I did the same.✅Hitting the Indian market with affordable prices is the best way to attract consumers.Do you have any other takeaways from this startup success story?#startupsuccess #indianstartups #founder #entrepreneurship

Great rejoicings and festivities followed the return of Sri Rama to Ayodhya and his crowning as the King. Lord Rama distributed gifts to all the monkeys who had served as warriors in his army. Sri Rama noticed his fervent devotee, Hanumanji and asked:“O mighty hero how am I to compensate you for all you have done for me and my family?”Many would have wanted wealth, name or fame, approbation or recognition or VIP line in return for their services. But Sri Hanuman was above all these:“I desire nothing, Prabhu!”Then, Maa Sita removed a valuable necklace of pearls from her neck and offered it to the humble Sri Hanuman.Sri Hanuman received the necklace with great respect from Mata Sita, but began to break the pearls with His teeth.Sita, and other ministers who were sitting in the council-hall, were quite astonished at this queer act of Sri Hanuman. Some wondered why the noble and great warrior Sri Hanuman was behaving like a monkey. Was it the monkey mind?Sita asked Hanuman, “O mighty Hero! What are You doing? Why do You break the pearls?”Sri Hanuman said, “O venerable Mother! It is the most valuable necklace, indeed, as it has come to me through Thy holy hand. But I want to find out whether any of the pearls contains my beloved Lord Rama. I do not keep a thing devoid of Him. I do not find Him in any of the pearls.”At this, one of the assembly members ironically remarked, “You would not wear any thing that has not got in it the Name of Rama. Well, You are wearing your body. You are carrying it about with you. Prove to us that you have the Name in it.”Hanuman laughed aloud; he said, “I shall prove, See!”Sri Hanuman then tore his chest open with his mighty hands and Lo! Sri Rama and Maa Sita were seated in his heart!Lord Rama came down the throne and embraced Hanuman and blessed Him. He asked him, “Hanuman! What can I offer you on this occasion? I have no gift worthy to be given to you. I am giving you myself as my gift to you.” Then, he offered his body to be clasped by Hanuman’s hands. The assembly was moved into shouts of “Jai ho” at this unique act of Grace. They praised Hanuman and declared that there was no one to equal him in all the worlds. They praised the devotion and dedication of Hanuman.When Sri Rama ascended to His Supreme abode, Hanuman also wished to follow Him. But the Lord asked him to remain in this world as His representative, and attend the assemblies of saints where discourses (katha) on His deeds were held and heard, and help His devotees in cultivating devotion.Hanumanji is a Chiranjeevi (immortal). He is everywhere. He who has devotion beholds Him, and receives His blessing.#india #hanuman #hanumanji #hanumanchalisa #lordhanuman #sanatandharma

I'm usually an optimistic person, but a few days ago I had an experience that felt like a kick in the face.Last year, I left my executive role at a startup, knowing that finding the "right" role in a challenging economic atmosphere would take time. So, I focused on specific roles and took time off to recharge.After chatting with some great teams, I decided to sign an exciting new leadership role with Uber. That was back in January, which gave me and my family time to prepare for a big move from our small Kibbutz in Israel to the Big 🍎 However, just a couple of days ago, after discussing move details with my recruiter and completing all pre-employment tasks, I received a call saying that my new role had been rescinded due to internal restructuring.I was devastated.To put things in context–We were all ready to move, my wife quit her Impactful position, we off-boarded our kids from school, rented our house, and of course invested a large amount of time and money into the move. But worst, mentally we were already there.Despite this setback, I refuse to let it define me. I'm using this as an opportunity to grow, learn, and adapt. I'm restarting my job search with renewed vigor and determination.I'm sharing my story to encourage anyone who may have faced a similar setback. It's not easy, but we can choose how we respond. Let's keep pushing forward and support each other along the way.Now what?If you, your organization, or someone you know is hiring design leaders across the US, I'd appreciate the connection. I'd love to support a mid-size design organization (20-40 designers) working on impactful consumer-facing products, surrounded by thoughtful, sharp peers. I'm open to principal individual contributor, player-coach, and mostly people leadership roles. #nevergiveup #jobsearch #resilience #leadership #openfornewopportunities #design

With the goal of providing more benefits for local communities and a better #transportation network, the Victorian Government's Level Crossing Removal Project is an initiative to remove all dangerous and congested level crossings (intersections where a highway crosses a railroad at-grade).Melbourne’s level crossing removal initiative involved the removal of 20 level crossings and the #construction of 13 new stations along the Frankston Line by 2029. Faced with several construction planning challenges when working in congested areas among a large stakeholder group, the project team upgraded its digital approach to a more seamless integrated solution to ensure efficient design and timely delivery of the project.ACCIONA used #SYNCHRO, along with other Bentley solutions, to reduce staging time by 67%. The project provided a digital asset that can now unlock new opportunities for the realization of an intelligent digital Victoria and was a winner at Bentley's 2022 Going Digital Awards in Infrastructure.#infrastructure #rail ACCIONA Australia

#money Insolvency: Does the party which initiate Insolvency has preferential right of claim settlement? To find answers to this vexing issue, one will have to delve deep into Insolvency law and the Companies Act. It will also involve recovery of Debts Due to Banks and Financial Institutions Act. Supreme Court in its judgment in DCM Financial  Services Ltd v. Neel Kamal Plastics Ltd, has ruled that the proceedings for liquidation of a company under the Companies Sct are not the same as an inter partes suit for recovery of money. In a money suit it may indeed be open to the plaintiff to accept any money outside the court from or on behalf of the defendant towards the full or partial satisfaction of his claim in the suit and to report the payment to the court for passing appropriate orders.But such is not the position in a proceeding for liquidation  of the company.Pooja Khandelwal ( Advocate ) Supreme Court of India #india #supremecourtofindia #lawyerlife #lawstudents #lawfirm #lawyersofinstagram #lawsuit #nclat #lawyers #law #lawyer #legal #lawfirm #lawyerlife #lawyersofinstagram #attorney #lawschool #attorneys #lawstudent #justice #advocate #supremecourt #lawstudents #legalnews #lawyering #court #personalinjury #attorneyatlaw #litigation #indianlaw #clat #lawyerslife #highcourt #advocates #legalupdates #judiciary #lawyerstyle #familylawattorney

Where and why are the #datastructures and #algorithms used? Part-2🎯𝐐𝐮𝐞𝐮𝐞𝐬: Queues are used for managing processes that need to be executed in a specific order, such as print jobs or network requests. They are also used in algorithms that require breadth-first search or other graph traversal algorithms. 🤔 👩‍💻Queues have a 𝒄𝒐𝒏𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒏𝒕-𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆 𝒄𝒐𝒎𝒑𝒍𝒆𝒙𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝒐𝒇 𝑶(1) for enqueue and dequeue operations, making them an efficient data structure for managing operations in a first-in-first-out (FIFO) manner.🚀𝑷𝒓𝒂𝒄𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒍 𝑼𝒔𝒂𝒈𝒆: In a restaurant ordering system, a queue can be used to manage orders placed by customers. Each order can be added to the end of the queue, and when the kitchen is ready to prepare a new order, the order at the front of the queue can be removed and prepared.🎯𝐓𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐬: Trees are used for hierarchical data structures, such as directory structures, organisation charts, and decision trees. They are also used in algorithms that require efficient searching and insertion operations, such as balanced binary search trees. 🤔 👩‍💻Trees have a time complexity of O(log n) for search, insert, and delete operations in a balanced tree, making them efficient for applications that require these operations.🚀𝑷𝒓𝒂𝒄𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒍 𝑼𝒔𝒂𝒈𝒆: In a file system, a tree can be used to represent the directory structure of files and folders. Each node in the tree represents a file or folder, and the links between nodes represent the parent-child relationships between them; Trees are widely used in databases to efficiently store and retrieve data. The most common use of trees in databases is in the form of B-trees and their variants, which are specialised trees designed for use in databases. B-trees are used to index data in databases, allowing for fast searches and retrievals of data. They are particularly useful for storing large amounts of data that can't fit entirely in memory, as they minimise disk reads by reducing the number of disk blocks that need to be accessed.🎯𝐆𝐫𝐚𝐩𝐡𝐬: Graphs are used for modelling relationships between objects, such as social networks, road networks, and computer networks. They are also used in algorithms that require graph traversal and shortest path algorithms. 🤔 👩‍💻 Graphs can have varying time complexities for operations depending on the specific algorithm used, but in general, they have a time complexity of O(V+E), where V is the number of vertices (users) and E is the number of edges (connections) in the graph.🚀𝑷𝒓𝒂𝒄𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒍 𝑼𝒔𝒂𝒈𝒆: To model the relationships between users of social networks; to model road networks in navigation applications such as Google Maps; Recommendation Systems: Each user and item is represented as a node, and the links between nodes represent user-item interactions or preferences. Graph algorithms can be used to generate recommendations for users based on their interactions with items and the interactions of other similar users.

✨ 𝐓𝐇𝐑𝐄𝐄 𝐘𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐂𝐄𝐈 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐩 𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐦𝐦𝐞... 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐰𝐞'𝐯𝐞 𝐣𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝐛𝐞𝐠𝐮𝐧! ✨🎯 17000+ students… 200+ colleges… 5+ countries… 65+ companies & 1000s of placement offers... Delighted & Proud to celebrate three years of the CEI Internship Programme!!!It has been an Amazing journey of three years! Offered by Confederation of Empowerment Initiatives (CEI) it has now been going strong for 27 back-to-back phases, and about to step into the next!What started as an Initiative for students who had just lost their Internships and Placements due to COVID lockdown, or those who wanted to do something meaningful during the lockdown and those who wanted to become COVID Warriors... ...the CEI Internship Programme has come a long way into developing as an Excellent Opportunity for Students from all Domains & Years, from all parts of the country & the world to upskill themselves in the upcoming niche domains, gain one-on-one mentorship under Global Industry Experts and train to become leaders in this Post-COVID AI Driven World.At the same time, the projects undertaken by our interns have a direct positive impact on the most backward and disenfranchised sections of society.What could be more beautiful than to ensure that as we climb up the ladder of success, we ensure that the lesser privileged also climb along with us. Isn't this the very Essence of Humanism that Prabhu Shri Ramchandra taught us through his life - 𝐭𝐨 𝐛𝐞 𝐄𝐦𝐩𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐝 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐄𝐦𝐩𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫 𝐎𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐒𝐞𝐥𝐟𝐥𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐥𝐲!As we are about to conclude Phase-27 of the CEI Internship Programme, I feel proud to show off the added feathers in our hat:🔹 Many more modules for the interns to work on, 🔹 Sunday Masterclasses & Saturday JIP HUB sessions by pioneers in various fields, 🔹 In-house Internship & Job Opportunities with our partners, 🔹 Unique award-winning Grassroots Empowerment Initiatives, 🔹 Institutional Collaborations ...to name a few.A big shout out to all our CEI Interns, CEI Team Leaders and CEI Alumni for being a part of this Success Story! And to all our Organisational Partners, Colleges & Educational Institutes for extending this opportunity to your students. And to all the CEI Leaders for providing your Valuable Time and Knowledge selflessly to our interns.We look forward to engaging with you at a much deeper level. Let's make this much bigger.𝐒𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐜𝐚𝐧 𝐚𝐩𝐩𝐥𝐲 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐂𝐄𝐈 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐩 𝐏𝐡𝐚𝐬𝐞-𝟐𝟖 𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞: https://bit.ly/3Sh0rnMFor any queries or collaborations, please do write to us on internships@ceiempowers.org or internships.cei@gmail.com OM Namah Shivay#internships #students #placements #empowerment Salil Lahiri (Shri Bhaiji) Dr.Shubhra Chakraborty🎯 Shraddha Chakraborty Riya Rastogi

I recently visited Kolkata to meet a client who was not very familiar with Influencers.The client we onboarded has always been using traditional methods like billboards and tv ads to do advertising. At the first meeting, they asked me, “What set procedure do you follow while selecting influencers? This is what I replied, There are several ways brands often look for creators : ✔ They may search for creators on various social media platforms using location, hashtags and keywords. ❌ But this will result in a huge pool of potential creators making it difficult to narrow down. It also makes understanding the audience difficult. ✔  A popular option is influencer marketing which provides a database of creators and tools for discovering and managing campaigns.❌  The data provided does not go beyond quantitative metrics like followers, views and likes.✔ Trusting their network, brands may ask other creators, industry experts, or customers for referrals or recommendations.❌ This will result in a limited pool of creators, and not all of them may be the right fit for the brand.✔  Brands look for reliability in creator partnerships, which represent a network of creators and offer campaign management services.❌ This gets very expensive, making it difficult for small brands to afford.While the above can help identify potential creators but are not enough to choose the right one. Here is what can be done: 🔸  No one understands their audience beyond their location and gender, so go beyond factors like engagement rate and shares. 🔸  To understand your audience, prompt genuine conversations with them and understand them accurately. 🔸  Understand what they like, think about, their affordability and who they are in the real world. They are consumers you target when doing a campaign. Why not take a step ahead and understand them better?  💭 By taking this step, brands can partner with creators who are a good fit for their campaign and discover hidden gems in achieving their goals including sales.If you’re a brand and want to explore influencer marketing campaign, reach out to us at @socialTag Or write to me at anushree@socialtagindia.com#influencermarketing #brands

Milk makes your bone stronger - a myth or truth. Were you also told this? I was definitely told. I was in love with milk and dairy products. And funny thing is I suffered with chronic lower back pain and shoulder pain for seven years. Nothing worked. Neither medicine nor milk Physiotherapy became the must. And if you stop, pain would come back, I so badly wanted to get rid of this pain that I ended up joining WILDFIT and became a certified coach with themMy life took a U turn from then on There was nothing that someone told me and I believed in thingsThis program is all about experiencingAnd I experienced itYesNo one believes thisI experienced that milk was one of the villain for my chronic pain My pain was reduced drastically.Hence, I am not saying leave milk forever. Let’s take a break and see how it affects you. What is your reason to drink milk?(P.S If you are struggling with any chronic pain in your body and do not want to have it any longer, DM me to discuss how I can help you to get rid of that pain)#healthandwellness #strategy#consciousliving #painrelief #selfcare #consciousankita

'Check wat voor een problematische shit deze chatbot zegt!'- Persoon die chatbot vraagt om problematische shit.🤖In de laatste Computer Club praten we over het belangrijke werk van professor Emily M. Bender (what's in a name?). Volgens haar blijven we in de val trappen om een mens te zoeken in een AI-systeem. Door dat antropomorfisme voeren we niet de juiste discussies: we fantaseren liever over AGI (AI met bewustzijn), dan dat we cruciale topics als bias behandelen (het feit dat GPT getraind is op een dataset tsjokvol discriminatie, sekisme, racisme, ...). Bovendien minimaliseren we zo ook onze eigen intelligentie, wAnT onZE hErSEnEN zIJn ToCH ooK geWOOn een CompUTER??En om terug te komen op bovenstaande quote, waarbij elke influencer over zichzelf struikelt op LinkedIn 'omdat ChatGPT nu toch wel iets Heel Zots heeft gezegd' ... Zo'n papegaai op statistische speed is indrukwekkende technologie. Maar het is geen intelligentie, want het snapt niet waarover het gaat, en bedoelt er niets mee. Mensen wel.

When it comes to tax-saving options, businesses have a wider range of choices compared to salaried individuals. One option is to pay reasonable salaries to family members who work for the business (up to the basic exemption limit), and such salaries can be deducted from the taxable income of the business. This ultimately reduces the overall tax liability of the business, and since the salary is under the basic exemption, individuals do not need to pay any tax.Another option available to taxpayers is to form a Hindu Undivided Family (HUF). By forming an HUF, the business profits can be distributed among the members, which reduces the overall tax liability. However, it is important to ensure that the HUF is formed for genuine reasons and not merely for tax-saving purposes.Discover the additional tax-saving option we shared in our recent reelhttps://lnkd.in/dS5zwHsU

5 Must Know #HR Attendance Metrics:1: Absence rate- (Absence days/workdays) x 1002: Unscheduled absence days per employee- Unscheduled absence days/number of employees.3: Unscheduled absence by type- Breakdown of above metrics by reason for absence, e.g., sick leave, family leave, work injury, etc. 4: Paid Time Off (PTO) utilization rate- (PTO hours/PTO hours accrued) x 1005: Average cost of unscheduled absence- Unscheduled absence days x direct daily compensation/FTE (full-time equivalent) #work #dataanalytics #google #attendancemanagement #manifesting

Elon Musk has laid off more than 6,000 people at Twitter since taking over the company, he told the BBC in a rare interview.Musk was quoted as saying in the interview that the social media platform now has only 1,500 employees, down from under 8,000 who were employed at the time of his acquisition. The reduction equates to roughly 80% of the company’s staff.It’s “not fun at all” and can sometimes be “painful,” the billionaire CEO told the British broadcaster at Twitter’s head office in San Francisco.

The PhonePe Offline Marketing & Sales Capability team recently partnered with the Reserve Bank Innovation Hub (RBIH) to conduct a UPI awareness workshop at Arvind Mills as part of the "Bridging the Digital Divide among Women Migrant Workers" initiative. The workshop aimed to educate the women employees of the mill. Following the workshop, our team discovered a few key insights. 1. Many of the women participants were interested in learning more about UPI as they were currently paying 1-1.5% commission to third parties when transferring money to their families in their native places, resulting in an annual expenditure of approximately Rs 970. 2. While 21% of the participants had the necessary resources to use UPI, they had concerns about its security. 3. Attendees were interested in learning more about the insurance options available through PhonePe. We're pleased that we were able to dispel their doubts and raise awareness about UPI as a safe and cost-effective means of transferring money.#phonepe #rbi #upi #awareness #workshop #learning

Even as rents are cooling in some parts of the country, it has never cost more to rent a Manhattan apartment as it did in March.Typically, rental activity builds from the spring to a peak in late summer, but median rent last month was the highest on record, according to a report from Douglas Elliman, a brokerage, and Miller Samuel, an appraisal and consultant firm.The median cost of renting an apartment in Manhattan was $4,175 in March. That’s up 12.8% from a year ago and up 2% from February, and marks the highest since last July, when rent was $4,150.

🎉 Discover the Benefits and Types of React Hooks! 🚀As a frontend developer, I've been using React for a while now, and I can tell you that React hooks are a game-changer! 🙌Here are some benefits of using React hooks:👉 Simplified State Management: With hooks, you can manage state in functional components without the need for class components, making your code simpler and easier to read.👉 Improved Code Reusability: React hooks allow you to encapsulate logic that can be reused across components, making your code more modular and easier to maintain.Here are some types of React hooks and what they do:🔗 useState: Allows you to declare and update state variables in a functional component. Example: const [count, setCount] = useState(0);🔗 useEffect: Allows you to manage side effects (e.g., API calls, DOM updates) in a functional component. Example: useEffect(() => { console.log('Hello, world!'); }, []);🔗 useContext: Allows you to access context values (e.g., user preferences, localization) in a functional component. Example: const { locale } = useContext(LocaleContext);🔗 useCallback: Allows you to memorize a function to prevent unnecessary re-renders. Example: const handleClick = useCallback(() => { console.log('Clicked!'); }, []);🔗 useMemo: Allows you to memorize a value to prevent unnecessary re-computations. Example: const result = useMemo(() => computeExpensiveValue(), [dep1, dep2]);If you haven't tried React hooks yet, I highly recommend giving them a go. They can help you write better code and improve the performance of your React applications. 👍#React #ReactHooks #FrontendDevelopment #WebDevelopment #javascript #interview #internship

Code for GovTech (#C4GT) is India’s first #OpenSource #GovTech community of #DigitalPublicGood (DPG) builders, adopters, and contributors. C4GT is designed as an experiential program that will give students & working professionals the opportunity to engage with pioneers in the Indian GovTech ecosystem and become lifetime contributors to building DPGs for solving complex governance problems at scale.Community building is at the heart of C4GT and the reason for the program’s genesis. But why is community building even important?​​Community contribution is essential in building DPGs because they are designed to benefit society as a whole. An example of this is #CoWin -  A Digital Public Good that has impacted every citizen in India by enabling easy access to vaccination records. ​​Community building is crucial as it ensures a diverse range of perspectives, skills, innovations, and experiences are brought to the table. It enables collaboration and cross-learning that helps to produce high-quality goods that meet the needs of different communities.Numerous DPG Builders in India are building solutions to create population-scale impact. They need a binding force of a strong open source DPG community to build for the next billion of Bharat. If you are interested in becoming a part of such a community aimed at building impactful solutions for India, join the C4GT Discord Community now  👉 https://lnkd.in/dFz3bP-hFor more details, visit our website 👉 https://lnkd.in/dh-MjFquSaurabh Garg | Abhishek Singh | Pramod Varma | Sanjay Jain | Varad Pande (वरद पाण्डे) | Puneet Joshi | Ravi Prakash | Shankar Maruwada | Manish Srivastava | Jagadish Babu | Kiran Anandampillai | Rahul Kulkarni | Gaurav Goel | Kriti Mittal | Ashwin Date | Ashish Yadav | Bharat Kashyap | Chakshu Gautam | Kartheek Reddy Palla | Shruti Agarwal | Manu Gupta | Manav Bharambe |  Samagra | Transforming Governance | Omidyar Network India | GitHub

It's been exactly 6 months since I moved to Canada 🇨🇦 permanently with my wife with our entire belongings packed in 4 suitcases. Here are the 6 lessons I learnt along the way:1. Like anything in life, your decision to immigrate should be based on what you want. Canada has its pros and cons. For me the pros like clean air, rule of law, good governance and higher level of social and work etiquette won over the insane cost of living and higher taxes.2. Surround yourself with positivity.  A lot of people will use their experience to scare you. But guess what, you are different. And times are different. Do not lose heart and stay focused on your goals.3. Keep an open and curious mind and you will learn everything eventually. For me it was learning how to drive here.4. Relationship matters. My wife is my biggest support and companion in this journey and made the transition almost a breeze. The friends we made here give the sense of security and belonging.5. Learn how to wash dishes, clean washrooms and segregate trash and you will stop hating the process 😛 6. Have patience and be resilient. Things ultimately improve 100% of time- you will have money in the account, a house in your name and a car in due time if you stick long enough.Pic is from our flight from Delhi to Vancouver on 14th Oct 2022.

🔥 18466163 page views.🔥 1855733 new users.🔥 ~20K active users daily.⏱ in 1.5 years.The above numbers are generated by takeUforward's website, which was launched ~18 months back. The entire website was on WordPress, we did not spend much time on the UX or on the features.⭕ Why WordPress?▪️After my full-time job and youtube, there was hardly any time left for me to work on it. Leaving my job is not an option, as the ad revenue in India is super low. I was never in for selling courses, so there wasn't any constant recurring revenue source.▪️I did not outsource it, because of multiple reasons. One of the primary being outsourcing educational websites is risky unless you can give it time. You need to know how things work, just in case, things go ugly when it grows big. Most freelancers write highly readable codes ;)⭕ Future?This will be running on the side, as we don't have any plans to sell courses. I am enjoying Software Engineering as of now, the day I don't enjoy it more, I will take this up as full-time, and start playing around with this.Once the currently running Strivers A2Z DSA Course is completed, we will shift towards LLD. We won't be moving towards web-dev, because I firmly believe you learn web dev the hard way, that is by spending hours yourself.🔔 I am thinking to bring in some new features to the website before the next placement season which can be helpful for you. I will love to hear what new features you will like to have on takeUforward. You can write them in the comments.I will see if the top-liked feature requests are possible or not. I also might end up getting some amazing ideas from you :)#takeUforward #SoftwareEngineering #Google #dsa #placements #interviewpreparation

To IP enthusiasts out there,For more than a century, you must have noticed, that the world’s wealthiest human being were associated with oil. Now, the wealthiest class is a knowledge worker. Name it, Elon Musk, Bernard, Jeff Bezos, Larry Page, Bill Gates, world’s wealthiest person, owns nothing of value except knowledge. Fighting to defend and extend the domain of their intellectual property is how they play the economic game. In addition, the world's major growth industries -such as microelectronics, biotechnology, designer-made materials, and telecommunications are brainpower industries. If their intellectual property can be copied easily, they will not be able to generate either wealth for their owners or high wages for their employees.Which is why, for the first time in history, the world’s wealthiest person is a knowledge worker. If you are betting on any other product than the knowledge, dear, you are doing it all wrong. “The world is changing” is the phrase long gone. Now, the leaders of the world are the person betting on their intellectual property. This urgent need has brought the need for more differentiated systems of determining who owns what, better protection for whatever is owned, and faster systems of dispute resolution. You see, if you are an intellectual person, I bet you’ll bet your all on #intellectualproperty . As these knowledge based industries are important in their own right, but they also enable other industries, in turn, to become knowledge based. And, in turn, has created vast opportunities in the field of IP Laws. I, with bunch of IP Enthusiasts, making a club to discuss and deliberate IP related works. If you want to join us in the race, I’m leaving the link of the group in comment box. Kindly comment “interested” so that I may acknowledge your presence. If you know someone doing great in IP laws. Tag them to show them a respect. 🙏 #oil #growth #opportunities #respect #leaders #designer #biotechnology #telecommunications #iplaw #ipr #iprights #patentlaw #trademark #copyright
