Are you a fresher looking to create a great CV that stands out to potential employers? Here are some tips to get you started:♾️Keep it concise: Your CV should be no more than two pages long. Make sure every sentence is relevant and adds value to your application.♾️Highlight your education: As a fresher, your education is likely your strongest asset. Make sure to include your academic qualifications and any relevant coursework or projects.♾️Showcase your skills: Even if you don't have much work experience, you likely have skills that are valuable to employers. Consider including a separate section that highlights your key skills and abilities.♾️Use action verbs: When describing your experiences, use strong action verbs (e.g. "developed," "managed," "created") to showcase your accomplishments and impact.♾️Tailor your CV to the job: Each job you apply for may have different requirements, so make sure to tailor your CV accordingly. Highlight experiences or skills that are relevant to the specific job you're applying for.Remember, your CV is often the first impression you make on a potential employer. Make sure it's polished, and professional, and highlights your unique strengths and accomplishments. Best of luck with your job search!Hosting a webinar to make your journey more easy join us & learn more https://lnkd.in/dDieTnW3#jobopportunities #jobforyou #cvwriting

Menstruation continues to be a taboo subject in India due to which menstrual health takes a setback. Adoption of newer, more hygienic methods is still considerably low amongst adolescent women in rural India. To address this gap, Tarun Bothra created a first of its kind biodegradable sanitary napkins - Saathi Pads.These pads are 100% biodegradable, compostable, and are made from banana fibers which is highly absorbent and abundantly available in India. Unlike wood pulp or cotton, it is an agricultural by-product and does not require additional land usage. The pads are all-natural pads and do not contain bleach or chemicals, making them safer for women. They also degrade within 6 months of disposal, 1200 times faster than conventional pads.Aarohan Social Innovation Awards by #InfosysFoundation helped Tarun Bothra reach a larger audience. Infosys | #sustainablemenstruation

‘You are quitting your job to rear donkeys? What a joke!! In the early 2000s, I had read about the benefits of donkey milk. It lingered in my memory and I felt compelled to carry out further research. “Goodknight” Mohan, who helped bring the “Goodknight” mosquito coil to the Indian household, was an inspiration. It was his unique invention that brought respite from mosquitoes of an entire nation. I wanted to do the same but in the cosmetics segment with a product that was innovative and effective. With this dream I took the plunge, quit my job in Bangalore and went back to Kerala. My friends and family were puzzled, to say the least, when I told them about the venture I was about to begin. "Stick to your job!”, they said “You are the donkey!” they concluded. With time, awareness about the harmful effects of chemicals found in cosmetics grew, and people began switching to natural alternatives. Using the lemongrass extraction technique that my great grandfather gave our family and freeze-dried donkey milk, I developed Dolphin IBA’s first cosmeceutical cream. The journey wasn’t easy at all, it was far from it. I lost 22 of the 38 donkeys in a deadly wave of bacterial infection at the start. In addition to the backlash I faced from friends and family. Being in a business that worked with donkey milk wasn’t very appealing to them. They all warmed up to the idea once the products entered the market and received a warm reception. The benefits of donkey milk have proved to be highly advantageous in treating certain skin conditions like Psoriasis and other inflammatory conditions. ‘Who would’ve thought that donkey milk could be two times more effective than mainstream cosmetic products!’ Exclaim clients all the way from Dubai to Hollywood. - Aby Baby (Founder, Dolphin_iba)#KuchTohLogKahenge #InspirationBrew #FounderStories

Dear Law Students,I’ve a good news for you. Do you know that in India, copyright protection is automatic as soon as an original work is created. Which means that as soon as you have completed your research paper, you automatically hold the copyright to it.Good news! Isn’t it?However, if you want to reinforce and establish your copyright, making it easier for you to prove your ownership and take legal action in case of infringement.Here are the steps you can take to establish and reinforce your copyright in India:Add a copyright notice: Add a copyright notice to your research paper to inform others that you own the copyright. A copyright notice typically includes the copyright symbol (©), the year of publication, and the name of the copyright owner (i.e., you). For example, "Copyright © 2023 [Your Name]."Although above mentioned step will suffice but if you want to register your copyright, You can register your copyright with the Copyright Office by filing an application and paying a fee.Although registration of copyright is not mandatory in India, it can be a good way to establish your ownership and prevent infringement.Here is another good news. You can get your content copyright (c) just at 500-1000₹. Isn’t it a good news?Need more information and assistance! Right ? Why don’t you join our group to get better and practical knowledge of functioning of IPR?If you are a professional, and ready to train law students on practice and procedure in IPR, kindly give your consent in the comment box. We’ll connect you with law student who is looking for an internship.Feel free to inbox me your ideas on helping law students. If you are a law student, and looking for internships in IPR, show your willingness in comment box so that we may connect you with professionals. #law #content #legal #love #work #india #research #students #ipr #iprights #copyright #patent #trademark #internships #internship

Recently, our colleagues in the NYC area gathered for “The Art of Networking" – an event for #WomenInTechnology celebrating International Women’s Day. The program focused on how networking can help build relationships, gain support, and build confidence. Here are 3 takeaways from the conversation to help you network:   1️⃣ Be authentic – Let your personality and values shine through as you build connections2️⃣ Be generous – Networking is a reciprocal relationship. Be generous with your time, knowledge and resources3️⃣ Be curious – Every person is a potential contact, so reach out and make a connection. Ask how you may be able to help support their goals.
